required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: From Short-term Surgical Missions Towards Sustainable Partnerships
clinical_study.official_title: From Short-term Surgical Missions Towards Sustainable Partnerships A Survey Among Active Members in the Global Surgical Workforce

brief_summary.textblock:
Introduction: Recently, the devastating consequences of neglected surgical care in global health became apparent with an estimated five billion people lacking access to safe surgical and anesthesia care. Traditionally, short-term surgical missions were the predominant strategy how surgical care was supported in Low- and Middle-Income Countries. Although surgical missions have been criticized in recent literature they are still being performed on a large scale. The aim of this study is to provide recommendations for persons and organizations involved in surgical mission on how to strengthen surgical care in LMICs in the future.
Method: An online survey was developed for members of foreign teams and local team members from LMICs. Data was collected on 5 topics, consisting of: 1) basic characteristics of the missions, 2) main activities, 2) follow-up and reporting, 3) the local registration process for foreign teams and 4) collaboration with local stakeholders.

primary_outcome.measure: obtaining information on organization of surgical missions
primary_outcome.description: questionnaire on basic characteristics of missions of the participants

primary_outcome.measure: activities of the missions now and for the future
primary_outcome.description: questionnaire on main activities, follow-up and reporting, the local registration process for the team, collaboration with local stakeholders

intervention.description: no intervention study, survey amongst health workers

study_pop.textblock: An international group of members of foreign teams and local team members from LMIC, that did participate in at least one short-term surgical mission in a hospital in a LMIC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
English speaking members of foreign teams and local team members from LMIC, that did participate in at least one short-term surgical mission in a hospital in a LMIC
Exclusion Criteria:
-

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data will be shared anonymously on this platform as requested by the journal of submission (int,. journal of surgery)
